about_the_game:
The author says

  • "A mysterious movie theater flyer...... A man who hasn't been home for a long time...... Surprising secrets about the video medium...... How extraterrestrial and cosmic life flows...... It's a love letter to the art of cinema, a chilling reflection. ”

  • Prism: Master Tape takes you deep into a place that sits on the edge of reality and transcends conventional perception. As you follow in the footsteps of the protagonist as they explore objects and move forward, "they" always call you: "No. 237 ......" - and thus begins this extraordinary adventure in an interactive clicker game with a side-scrolling third-person object perspective and a first-person subject perspective.

  • Prism: Master Tape somewhat eschews traditional gameplay in favor of a purely story-driven experience, where you can't save and read files, as if you were going to the cinema to watch a movie. Blends eerie environments, white noise, poetry, and narrated texts to weave a story with a novel perspective on the flow of life in the universe.

  • Many of the images here are a tribute to the art of cinema, and every corner hides secrets waiting to be discovered. The player is not only solving the puzzle, but also experiencing a reflection: thinking about the delicate relationship between human and media development, reality and illusion. When all the clues come together into a complete picture, you will revisit your definition of "real" and find your own way out.

  • Remember, don't overlook a movie that may "not exist". And you may be part of the movie. Give yourself time to watch and perform one of these "movies".

    Again, the author says:

  • This is the first title 0x0 Game studio. My buddies have been busy lately and for various reasons, I have done it all by myself. Writing this, I don't seem to have any regrets at the moment. Thank them, sincerely.

  • Thank you for playing my game, sincerely.

                                                                                                                                     -XuRongzhi

    Instructions

  • In landscape mode, press and hold the A and D keys on your keyboard to control your character's movement.

  • In some cases, pressing and holding the A and D keys on your keyboard can control your character's camera movement.

  • In the first person, a left-click is sufficient.

name: Prism: Master Tape

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7 SP1 or later
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-4170 or equivalent AMD processor
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Supports DirectX 10, with 1 GB VRAM dedicated graphics
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: The logical size of the game file is 7.42 GB, but the disk space required for the actual installation is only 1.84 GB. This is because the game contains some efficiently compressed resource files that are automatically unzipped to the appropriate size during installation. To ensure the best experience, it is recommended that players reserve at least 2 GB of free space.

short_description: This is a dystopian soft sci-fi game. One day, you and your family received a flyer from the community to watch a movie for free. Your family has already set off, and you arrived later – but you find out that they are not there. After that, you discover the untold secrets of the medium of "video".
supported_languages:
English*, Simplified Chinese
*languages with full audio support
